nodes.message:
A commit from someone with no GitHub account

Summary:
This is a commit to master by a user with email at `example.com`, which
should not be linked to any GitHub account.

Generated with:

    git -c user.name='Mysterious Stranger' \
        -c user.email='mysterious-stranger@example.com' \
        commit -S

Actually committed and signed by William Chargin <wchargin@gmail.com>.
Verify public key at either of:
  - <https://github.com/wchargin.gpg>
  - <https://wchargin.github.io/> (click link to "My PGP key")

Hello from credbot!

Summary:
This is a commit to master under the name and email of credbot, who has
no other contributions to the repository. This is intended to test that
we can still pull the correct GitHub user off of the commit.

Generated with:

    git -c user.name='credbot' \
        -c user.email='42819382+credbot@users.noreply.github.com' \
        commit

Actually committed and signed by William Chargin <wchargin@gmail.com>.
Verify public key at either of:
  - <https://github.com/wchargin.gpg>
  - <https://wchargin.github.io/> (click link to "My PGP key")

This pull request will be more contentious. I can feel it... (#5)

* This pull request will be more contentious. I can feel it...

* Address wchargin's unreasonable complaints

Merge pull request #3 from sourcecred/add-readme

Add README, merge via PR.

nodes.body: This is just an example issue.
nodes.title: An example issue.

nodes.body: This issue references another issue, namely #1
It should also be possible to reference by exact url: https://github.com/sourcecred/example-github/issues/6

We might also reference individual comments directly.
https://github.com/sourcecred/example-github/issues/6#issuecomment-373768538
Here's a PR by direct url: https://github.com/sourcecred/example-github/pull/5
a PR review by url: https://github.com/sourcecred/example-github/pull/5#pullrequestreview-100313899
a PR Review Comment by url: https://github.com/sourcecred/example-github/pull/5#discussion_r171460198
a user by url: https://github.com/wchargin

Here are several references:
#1 
#2
#3 

https://github.com/sourcecred/example-github/pull/5#discussion_r171460198
https://github.com/sourcecred/example-github/pull/5#pullrequestreview-100313899
This comment has no references.

nodes.title: A referencing issue.

nodes.body: Alas, its life as an open issue had only just begun.
nodes.title: A closed pull request

nodes.body: This issue shall shortly have a few comments.
A wild COMMENT appeared!
And the maintainer said, "Let there be comments!"
This comment references an #2, which itself references an issue. This comment is thus allows us to test that in-references are not included when requesting a Post's references.
Hi! I'm a bot! Beep boop beep!!

nodes.title: An issue with comments

nodes.body: Deal with this, naive string display algorithms!!!!!
nodes.title: An issue with an extremely long title, which even has a VerySuperFragicalisticialiManyCharacterUberLongTriplePlusGood word in it, and should really be truncated intelligently or something

nodes.body:
This issue was paired with @wchargin 

It also attempts to reference itself: #10

It also references something twice: #2 #2
nodes.title: Paired with multireference

nodes.body: @wchargin-ghost002, show yourself.
Hello. :ghost:

[Here is a screenshot of the thread at this point, prior to account deletion.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4317806/45455614-8c4fe600-b69c-11e8-902e-aec65d7403e6.png)

The user has GraphQL ID `MDQ6VXNlcjQzMjIyMTkw` and database ID `43222190`.

The previous comment has GraphQL ID `MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQyMDgxMTg3Mg==` and database `420811872`.
My time in this life draws to a close. :wave:

:skull: :ghost:
RIP

nodes.body: I'm reacting to this with every emoji.
nodes.title: An issue with reactions

nodes.body: Oh look, it's a pull request.
It seems apropos to reference something from a pull request comment... eg: #2

nodes.title: Add README, merge via PR.

nodes.body:
@wchargin could you please do the following:
- add a commit comment
- add a review comment requesting some trivial change
- i'll change it
- then approve the pr
In retrospect, this was an excellent PR.
